result.execSummary:
The defendant Gustavo Valdez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property fr. Person/Corpse, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration or Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes: Restitution to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision. (paid to Jiffy's) Restitution to be paid before costs and fines.

Court costs and DNA to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

Any conditions to be determined by Probation and Parole.
To provide DNA sample.

Letter file by Joanne V requesting the defendant be released on house arrest. 
  **Reviewed by Judge Brad D. Schimel on 04/07/2020: Denied. Defendant's daughter is not a party to this case, and has no standing to seek a sentence modification.** 04/08/2020 - daughter notified.

Motion for Injunction filed by defendant
  **Reviewed by Judge Brad D. Schimel on 7/6:  The defendant's Motion for Injunction is denied. There is no evidence that the legislature did not intend that 2015 Act 355 to inmates serving a sentence at the time of enactment. Thus, the Department of Corrections is within its authority to apply Act 355 to the defendant's case.**

records.descr: Remittitur/Court of Appeals dec & order affirming

records.addlTxt:
Certified Copy of Order Dated:  09/11/19
Summary disposition orders may not be cited in any court of this state as precedent or authority, except for the limited purposes specified in WIS. STAT. RULE 809.23(3).
Gustavo Valdez appeals pro se from a judgment of conviction and an order denying his postconviction motion.  He seeks to withdraw his guilty pleas.  Based upon our review of the briefs and record, we conclude at conference that this case is appropriate for summary disposition.  We Affirm.
IT IS ORDERED that the judgment and order of the circuit court are summarily affirmed pursuant to WIS. STAT. RULE 809.21.
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this summary disposition order will not be published.

Defendant Gustavo Valdez in court, in custody, by video, with attorney Colleen Marie Marion.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Attorney Valdez provides a statement to the court that he would like to represent himself.    Attorney Marion provides a statement to the court.  The Court permits the defendant to waive his right to counsel and finds he is competent to represent himself.   The court grants Attorney Marion's motion to withdraw as counsel. The State to file a response within 30 days to the Defendant's Motion for Postconviction Relief to Withdraw Plea in Both Counties for Ineffective Assistance of Counsel.  The Court schedules the case for a hearing in 45 days for scheduling of the motion hearing.  The Defendant to appear by video at the next hearing.  Hearing scheduled for August 21, 2017 at 10:00 am. Defendant Gustavo Valdez in court, in custody, with attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse.   Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

COUNT #1:

IMPOSED SENTENCE of: 

10 YEARS IMPRISONMENT  (consecutive to Count #3)
  -5 YEAR(S) OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  - 5 YEAR(S) OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  to be determined by Probation and Parole.

RESTITUTION:  $550.00 (to be paid to Jiffy's as a condition of extended supervision - restitution to be paid before costs or fines);

COURT COSTS:  $278.00 (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $ 250.00 (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision); Defendant to provide sample. 

Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is not eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

COUNT #3:

IMPOSED SENTENCE of: 

6 YEARS IMPRISONMENT  (consecutive to any other sentence)
  -3 YEAR(S) OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -3 YEAR(S) OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
to be determined by Probation and Parole.

COURT COSTS:  $268.00 (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision);

Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is not eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
